item.title: By: Janice Lee
item.dc:creator: Janice Lee
item.content:encoded:
This is a good post. I just disagree w/ the part that says “They offer (mostly) unsolicited help”. A forum afterall is mostly a place where you can ask, get, and plead for help–so the help’s definitely solicited.:) I’m guessing it’s a typo error?

I like this post especially the part about giving back. For me, the best thing about giving back is it forces you to review/research before answering to avoid giving false information. So you’re right, you learn and re-learn.

I have never been addicted to forums but hey, I need an addiction so maybe I’ll try this out. ðŸ˜‰ I’d be the F5-addict (waiting for someone to just validate my oh-so-researched-response…do forum addicts people do that?)

You know onpnt what would be a good idea (and maybe it’s already planned and coming out this week)– an article on community etiquette! Like

1) don’t forget to say thanks
2) always play nice
3) make it easy for others to help you (ie, provide details)
4) don’t be scared to admit it if you’re wrong
5) don’t gloat when you’re right
6) don’t call anyone stupid
7) don’t call anyone sort of stupid
8) don’t be mad when you’re called stupid… etc etc.

I think that would be a great and much needed post! Maybe next time?

Good job on this! ðŸ™‚ Looking forward to the next articles.
